title: Ray Liotta looks dapper in all-black ensemble as he joins model daughter Karsen at AMPAS event
text:
He is best known for his captivating role as Henry Hill in the 1990's crime drama Goodfellas, and has been considered Hollywood royalty ever since.

And Ray Liotta looked suave as he attended the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences New Members Event in London on Saturday with daughter Karsen.

The actor, 64, was every inch the proud day as he posed with his only child, 20, at the event - which saw him reunite with his Marriage Story co-star Laura Dern.

Proud: Ray Liotta looked suave as he attended the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences New Members Event in London on Saturday with daughter Karsen

Ray looked sharp in a black shirt and jacket paired with matching trousers as he embraced his daughter.

His salt and pepper locks were slicked back from his face while the star smiled for the cameras.

Karsen flashed her midriff in a velvet blue cropped jacket paired with a matching skirt.

Her tresses were pulled into a chic updo while she adorned her pout with red lipstick.

Happy family: The actor, 64, was every inch the proud day as he posed with his only child, 20, at the event - which saw him reunite with his Marriage Story co-star Laura Dern

Ray was previously married to Michelle Grace until 2004 but they are understood to have remained great friends.

She worked on four films with Ray - two as an actress and two as a producer - the most recent one, 2006's Take The Lead, was two years after their divorce.

Karsen is also an actress -she starred alongside her parents in the 2000 film A Rumor Of Angels when she was just one.

In recent years she starred in 2018 series Shades of Blue.

Sharp: Ray looked sharp in a black shirt and jacket paired with matching trousers

Rising to fame as a heartthrob in notorious gangster film, Ray is widely recognised for his role as the American mobster in Goodfellas.

The Newark native starred in the prestigious movie alongside fellow Hollywood actors Robert De Niro and Joe Pesci.

Goodfellas follows the success and failure of Ray's character, while also following the lives of his close associates from the late 50s till the early 80s.
